title: PocketStudio
text:
PocketStudio by <a href="Winsoft">Winsoft</a> is an <a href="Integrated%20development%20environment">IDE</a> supporting <a href="Rapid%20application%20development">rapid application development (RAD)</a> for <a href="Palm%20OS">Palm OS</a> and related operating systems such as <a href="Garnet%20OS">Garnet OS</a> or <a href="Access%20Linux%20Platform">Access Linux Platform</a>. In some regard similar to <a href="Borland%20Delphi">Delphi</a> and <a href="Lazarus%20%28software%29">Lazarus</a>, it has a visual form designer, an object inspector and a <a href="source%20code%20editor">source code editor</a>.
Distinguishing features.
PocketStudio's programming language is a subset of <a href="Pascal%20%28programming%20language%29">Pascal</a> that has been adapted to the needs of Palm OS development. The <a href="compiler">compiler</a> generates native code targeting the <a href="M68k">Motorola MC68000 family</a> microprocessor.
For <a href="debugging">debugging</a>, the Palm OS <a href="emulator">emulator</a> <a href="POSE">POSE</a> is embedded. As an alternative, the Garnet OS simulator can be used. PocketStudio integrates wireless development including <a href="Bluetooth">Bluetooth</a> technologies. Other features are a project manager, code templates, inline <a href="Assembly%20language">assembler</a> support and code examples.
The IDE runs on <a href="Microsoft%20Windows">Windows</a> and generates <a href="PRC%20%28Palm%20OS%29">PRC</a> files for being transferred to handhelds via <a href="HotSync">HotSync</a> or for distribution via <a href="internet">internet</a> or storage media.
Supporting third party libraries.
Several APIs support development with PocketStudio via special libraries. Examples are:
